classRec.name: DynamicState
classRec.description: This contains a session state object plus some metadata: objectName and className.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: cast
method.description: This function can be used to detect DynamicState objects within nested, untyped session state objects. If an object has only three properties (objectName, className, sessionState), this function will return a DynamicState object having those values. Otherwise, null is returned because the object is assumed to be incompatible.
method.param: object An object that has all the properties that DynamicState has.
createNewObject If this is set to true, this function will return a new DynamicState object even if the given object is already a DynamicState.
method.return: Either a DynamicState object or null if the cast failed.

field.name: className
field.description: This is the qualified class name of the original object providing the session state.

field.name: objectName
field.description: This is the name assigned to the object when the session state is generated.

field.name: sessionState
field.description: This is the session state for an object of the type specified by className.

classRec.name: ClassUtils
classRec.description: ClassUtils This is an all-static class containing functions related to qualified class names.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: cacheClassInfo
method.description: This function will populate the classImplementsMap and classExtendsMap for the given qualified class name.
method.param: classQName A qualified class name.
method.return: true if the class info has been cached.

method.name: classExtends
method.param: classQName A qualified class name of a class in question.
extendsQName A qualified class name that the class specified by classQName may extend.
method.return: true if clasQName extends extendsQName, or if the two QNames are equal.

method.name: classImplements
method.param: classQName A qualified class name.
implementsQName A qualified interface name.
method.return: true if the class implements the interface, or if the two QNames are equal.

method.name: classIs
method.param: classQName A qualified class name.
isQName A qualified class or interface name.
method.return: true if classQName extends or implements isQName, or if the two QNames are equal.

method.name: getClassDefinition
method.description: This function gets a Class definition for a qualified class name.
method.param: classQName The qualified name of a class.
method.return: The class definition, or null if the class cannot be resolved.

method.name: loadSWF
method.description: This function loads a SWF library into the current ApplicationDomain so getClassDefinition() and getDefinitionByName() can get its class definitions.
method.param: source Either the URL to a SWF or a ByteArray containing the SWF to load.
callback The function to call when the SWF is finished loading.
callbackParams Optional parameters to pass to the callback function.

field.name: classExtendsMap
field.description: This maps a qualified class name to an object. For each interface the class extends, the object maps the qualified class name of the interface to a value of true.

field.name: classImplementsMap
field.description: This maps a qualified class name to an object. For each interface the class implements, the object maps the qualified class name of the interface to a value of true.

classRec.name: ExternalSessionStateInterface
classRec.description:
A set of static functions intended for use as a JavaScript API.
The user interface in Weave is initially generated from a saved session state. User interactions affect the session state, and changes in the session state affect the display at runtime. The API provides a window into the session state so most interactions that can be made through the GUI can also be made through JavaScript calls.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: convertSessionStateObjectToXML
method.description: This function serializes a session state from Object format to XML String format.
method.param: sessionState A session state object.
tagName The name to use for the root XML tag that gets generated from the session state.
method.return: An XML serialization of the session state.

method.name: convertSessionStateToPrimitives
method.description: This function modifies a session state, converting any nested XML objects to Strings.
method.param: state A session state that may contain nested XML objects.

method.name: convertSessionStateXMLToObject
method.description: This function converts a session state from XML format to Object format. Nested XML objects will be converted to Strings before returning.
method.param: sessionState A session state that has been encoded in XML. This can be supplied as either an XML object or a String.
method.return: The deserialized session state object.

method.name: getChildNames
method.description: This function gets a list of names of children of an object appearing in the session state.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: An Array of names of sessioned children of the object referred to by objectPath, or null if the object doesn't exist.

method.name: getObject
method.description: This function returns a pointer to an object appearing in the session state. This function is not intended to be accessible through JavaScript.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: A pointer to the object referred to by objectPath.

method.name: getObjectType
method.description: This function will get the qualified class name of an object appearing in the session state.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: The qualified class name of the object referred to by objectPath.

method.name: getSessionState
method.description: This function gets the current session state of an object. Nested XML objects will be converted to Strings before returning.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: An object containing the values from the sessioned properties.

method.name: removeObject
method.description: This function will remove a dynamically created object if it is the child of an ILinkableCompositeObject.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: true if objectPath refers to a valid location where dynamically created objects can exist.

method.name: requestObject
method.description: This function will dynamically create an object at the specified location in the session state if its parent implements ILinkableCompositeObject. If the object at the specified location already exists and is of the requested type, this function does nothing. If the parent of the dynamic object to be created implements ILinkableHashMap, a value of null for the child name will cause a new name to be generated. If the parent of the dynamic object to be created implements ILinkableDynamicObject, the name of the child refers to the name of a static object appearing at the top level of the session state. A child name equal to null in this case will create a local object that does not appear at the top level of the session state.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
objectType The qualified name of a class implementing ILinkableObject.
method.return: true if, after calling this function, an object of the requested type exists at the requested location.

method.name: setChildNameOrder
method.description: This function will reorder children of an object implementing ILinkableHashMap.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
orderedChildNames The new order to use for the children of the object specified by objectPath.
method.return: true if objectPath refers to the location of an ILinkableHashMap.

method.name: setLinkableObjectRoot
method.description: This function sets the root object that will be used by the other functions in this class. This function must be called before the JavaScript API can be used.
method.param: root The root ILinkableObject to be used by the external interface functions.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: This function updates the current session state of an object.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
newState An object containing the new values for sessioned properties in the sessioned object.
removeMissingDynamicObjects If true, this will remove any properties from an ILinkableCompositeObject that do not appear in the new session state.
method.return: true if objectPath refers to an existing object in the session state.

classRec.name: StageUtils
classRec.description:
This is an all-static class that allows you to add callbacks that will be called when an event occurs on the stage.
WARNING: These callbacks will trigger on every mouse and keyboard event that occurs on the stage. Developers should not add any callbacks that run computationally expensive code.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: addEventCallback
method.description:
WARNING: These callbacks will trigger on every mouse event that occurs on the stage. Developers should not add any callbacks that run computationally expensive code.
This function will add a callback using the given function and parameters. Any callback previously added for the same function will be overwritten.
method.param: eventType The name of the event to add a callback for, one of the static values in the MouseEvent class.
callback The function to call when an event of the specified type is dispatched from the stage.
parameters An array of parameters that will be used as parameters to the callback function.
runCallbackNow If this is set to true, the callback will be run immediately after it is added.

method.name: callLater
method.description: This calls a function in a future ENTER_FRAME event. The function call will be delayed further frames if the maxComputationTimePerFrame time limit is reached in a given frame.
method.param: relevantContext This parameter may be null. If the relevantContext object gets disposed of, the specified method will not be called.
method The function to call later.
parameters The parameters to pass to the function.

method.name: generateListeners
method.description: This is for internal use only. These inline functions are generated inside this function to avoid re-use of local variables.
method.param: eventType An event type to generate a listener function for.
method.return: An event listener function for the given eventType that updates static variables and runs event callbacks.

method.name: handleEnterFrame
method.description: This function gets called on ENTER_FRAME events.

method.name: handleMouseClick
method.description: This function gets called when a mouse click event occurs.

method.name: handleMouseDown
method.description: This function gets called when a mouse click event occurs.

method.name: initialize
method.description: initialize static callback collections.

method.name: removeEventCallback
method.param: eventType The name of the event to remove a callback for, one of the static values in the MouseEvent class.
callback The function to remove from the list of callbacks.

method.name: altKey
method.return: The current pressed state of the ctrl key.

method.name: ctrlKey
method.return: The current pressed state of the ctrl key.

method.name: currentFrameElapsedTime
method.description: This is the amount of time the current frame has taken to process so far.

method.name: event
method.description: This is the last event that occurred on the stage. This variable is set while callbacks are running and is cleared immediately after.

method.name: keyboardEvent
method.description: This is the last keyboard event that occurred on the stage. This variable is set while callbacks are running and is cleared immediately after.

method.name: mouseButtonDown
method.return: The current pressed state of the mouse button.

method.name: mouseEvent
method.description: This is the last mouse event that occurred on the stage. This variable is set while callbacks are running and is cleared immediately after.

method.name: mouseMoved
method.return: true if the mouse moved since the last frame.

method.name: previousFrameElapsedTime
method.description: This is the total time it took to process the previous frame.

method.name: shiftKey
method.return: The current pressed state of the ctrl key.

method.name: shouldCallLater
method.description: This function can be used to ensure the flash interface is reasonably responsive during long asynchronous computations. If this function returns true, it is recommended to use StageUtils.callLater() to delay asynchronous processing until the next frame.
method.return: A value of true if the currentFrameElapsedTime has reached the maxComputationTimePerFrame threshold.

field.name: POINT_CLICK_EVENT
field.description: This is a special pseudo-event supported by StageUtils. Callbacks added to this event will only trigger when the mouse was clicked and released at the same screen location.

field.name: _callLaterArray
field.description: This is an array of functions with parameters that will be executed the next time handleEnterFrame() is called. This array gets populated by callLater().

field.name: _callLaterSingleFrameDelayArray
field.description: This is an array of functions with parameters that will be executed the next time handleEnterFrame() is called. This array gets populated by callLater().

field.name: _callbackCollections
field.description: This is a mapping from an event type to a callback collection associated with it. Event types are those defined in static constants of the MouseEvent class.

field.name: _eventTypes
field.description: This is a list of supported events.

field.name: _generatedListeners
field.description: This Array is used to keep strong references to the generated listeners so that they can be added with weak references. The weak references only matter when this code is loaded as a sub-application and later unloaded.

field.name: _initializeTimer
field.description: This timer is only used if initialize() is attempted before the stage is accessible.

field.name: _lastMouseDownPoint
field.description: This is the stage location of the last mouse-down event.

field.name: _lastMousePoint
field.description: This object contains the stage coordinates of the mouse for the current frame.

field.name: _stage
field.description: This is a pointer to the stage. This is null until initialize() is successfully called.

field.name: maxComputationTimePerFrame
field.description: This is the recommended upper bound of computation time per frame. The "get shouldCallLater()" function uses this value along with currentFrameElapsedTime to determine its recommendation.

classRec.name: UIUtils
classRec.description: This is an all-static class containing functions related to UI and ILinkableObjects.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: addChild
method.description: This function will add a sessioned UIComponent to a parent UIComponent.
method.param: uiParent The parent UIComponent to add a child to.
hashMap A LinkableHashMap containing a dynamically created UIComponent.
childName The name of a child in the hashMap.

method.name: handleHashMapChildListChange
method.description: This function gets called when a LinkableHashMap changes that was previously linked with a DisplayObjectContainer through linkUIComponents(). Any sessioned DisplayObjects that were added/removed/reordered will be handled here.
method.param: uiParent A DisplayObjectContainer to synchronize with the given hashMap.
hashMap A LinkableHashMap containing sessioned DisplayObjects to synchronize with the given uiParent.

method.name: linkDisplayObjects
method.description: This function adds a callback to a LinkableHashMap to monitor any DisplayObjects contained in it.
method.param: uiParent A UIComponent to synchronize with the given hashMap.
hashMap A LinkableHashMap containing DisplayObjects to synchronize with the given uiParent.

method.name: unlinkDisplayObjects
method.description: This function will undo the linking done by linkUIComponents(uiParent, hashMap).
method.param: uiParent The uiParent parameter for a previous call to linkUIComponents().
hashMap The hashMap parameter for a previous call to linkUIComponents().

method.name: updateChildOrder
method.description: This function updates the order of the children in the uiParent based on the session state.
method.param: uiParent
hashMap
keepLinkableChildrenOnTop

field.name: childToEventListenerMap
field.description: This maps a child UIComponent to a FlexEvent.REMOVE event listener.

field.name: parentToBusyFlagMap
field.description: This maps a parent to a Boolean value which indicates whether or not UIUtils is busy processing some event for that parent.

field.name: parentToListenerMap
field.description: This maps a UIComponent to a listener function created by linkUIComponents().

classRec.name: ErrorManager
classRec.description: This class is a central location for reporting and detecting errors. The callbacks for this object get called when an error is reported.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: reportError
method.description: This function is intended to be the global error reporting mechanism for Weave.

method.name: errors
method.description: This is the list of all previous errors.

classRec.name: WeaveXMLDecoder
classRec.description: XMLDecoder This extension of SimpleXMLDecoder adds support for XML objects encoded with XMLEncoder. The static methods provided here eliminate the need to create an instance of XMLDecoder.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: decode
method.description: decode This static function eliminates the need to create an instance of XMLDecoder.
method.param: xml An XML to decode.
method.return: An object derived from the XML.

method.name: decodeDynamicState
method.description: decodeTypedSessionState This static function eliminates the need to create an instance of XMLDecoder.
method.param: xml An XML to decode.
method.return: A vector of TypedSessionState objects derived from the XML, which is assumed to be encoded properly.

method.name: decodeDynamicStateXMLNode
method.description: end of static section

method.name: decodeXML
method.description: decodeXML This implementation adds support for a special attribute named 'encoding' which tells the decoder how it should be decoded.

method.name: getClassDefinition
method.description: getClassDefinition This function will check all the packages specified in the static defaultPackages Array if the specified packageName returns no result.
method.param: className The name of a class.
packageName The package the class exists in.
method.return: The class definition, or null if the class cannot be resolved.

method.name: includePackages
method.description: This function will include a package in ClassUtils.defaultPackages, which is consulted when decoding dynamic session states.

field.name: defaultPackages
field.description: The list of packages to check for classes when calling getClassDefinition().

classRec.name: WeaveXMLEncoder
classRec.description: XMLEncoder This extension of SimpleXMLEncoder adds support for encoding TypedSessionState objects, XML values, and null values. The static encode() method eliminates the need to create an instance of XMLEncoder.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: WeaveXMLEncoder
method.description: end of static section

method.name: encode
method.description: encode This static function eliminates the need to create an instance of XMLEncoder.
method.param: object An object to encode in xml.
method.return: The xml encoding of the object.

method.name: setAttributeAndReplaceNode
method.description: setAttributeAndReplaceNode This function provides a workaround for a bug that occurs when setting an attribute in an XMLNode. If you try to do node.attributes.attributeName = "value", sometimes node.toString() will return something like 'attributeName="value" <nodeName />'.
method.param: node An XMLNode, possibly a child of another XMLNode. This will be replaced with a new XMLNode.
attributeName The name of the attribute to set.
attributeValue The new value for the specified attribute.
method.return: A new XMLNode object containing the new attribute value, made a child of the parent of the given node if applicable.

field.name: XML_ENCODING
field.description: encoding types

classRec.name: CallbackCollection
classRec.description: This class manages a list of callback functions.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: CallbackCollection
method.description: If specified, the preCallback function will be called immediately before running each callback. This means if there are five callbacks added, preCallback() gets called five times whenever _runCallbacksImmediately() is called. An example usage of this is to make sure a relevant variable is set to the appropriate value while each callback is running. If preCallback() takes any parameters, they must be made optional. The preCallback function will not be called before grouped callbacks.
method.param: preCallback An optional function to call before each immediate callback.

method.name: _handleGroupedCallbacks
method.description: This function gets called once per frame and allows grouped callbacks to run.

method.name: _runCallbacksImmediately
method.description: This function runs callbacks immediately, ignoring any delays. The preCallback function will be called with the specified preCallbackParams arguments.
method.param: preCallbackParams The arguments to pass to the preCallback function given in the constructor.

method.name: addGroupedCallback
method.description: This function will add a callback that will be delayed except during a scheduled time each frame. Grouped callbacks use a central trigger list, meaning that if multiple CallbackCollections trigger the same grouped callback before the scheduled time, it will behave as if it were only triggered once. For this reason, grouped callback functions cannot have any parameters. Adding a grouped callback to a CallbackCollection will replace any previous effects of addImmediateCallback() or addGroupedCallback() made to the same CallbackCollection. The callback functionwill not be called recursively as a result of it triggering callbacks recursively.
method.param: relevantContext If this is not null, then the callback will be removed when the relevantContext object is disposed via SessionManager.dispose(). This parameter is typically a 'this' pointer.
groupedCallback The callback function that will only be allowed to run during a scheduled time each frame. It must not require any parameters.
triggerCallbackNow If this is set to true, the callback will be triggered to run during the scheduled time after it is added.

method.name: addImmediateCallback
method.description: This function will add a callback using the given function and parameters. Any callback previously added for the same function will be overwritten. The callback function will not be called recursively as a result of it triggering callbacks recursively.
method.param: relevantContext If this is not null, then the callback will be removed when the relevantContext object is disposed via SessionManager.dispose(). This parameter is typically a 'this' pointer.
callback The function to call when callbacks are triggered.
parameters An array of parameters that will be used as parameters to the callback function.
runCallbackNow If this is set to true, the callback will be run immediately after it is added.

method.name: delayCallbacks
method.description: This will increase the delay count by 1. To decrease the delay count, use resumeCallbacks(). As long as the delay count is greater than zero, effects of triggerCallbacks() will be delayed.

method.name: dispose
method.description: This will remove all callbacks. This function should only be called when this CallbackCollection is no longer needed.

method.name: removeCallback
method.param: callback The function to remove from the list of callbacks.

method.name: resumeCallbacks
method.description: This will decrease the delay count if it is greater than zero. If triggerCallbacks() was called while the delay count was greater than zero, immediate callbacks will be called now.
method.param: undoAllDelays If this is set to true, the delay count will be set to zero. Otherwise, the delay count will be decreased by one.

method.name: triggerCallbacks
method.description: This will trigger every callback function to be called with their saved arguments. If the delay count is greater than zero, the callbacks will not be called immediately.

method.name: callbacksAreDelayed
method.description: While this is true, it means the delay count is greater than zero and the effects of triggerCallbacks() are delayed until resumeCallbacks() is called to reduce the delay count.

method.name: callbacksWereTriggered
method.description: This flag is true between the time that callbacks are triggered and the time immediate callbacks finish being called. It is necessary in some situations to check this flag to determine if cached data should be used.

method.name: wasDisposed
method.description: This flag becomes true after dispose() is called.

field.name: _callbackEntries
field.description: This is a list of CallbackEntry objects in the order they were created.

field.name: _callbacksAreRunning
field.description: If this is true, it means _runCallbacksImmediately() is currently executing.

field.name: _delayCount
field.description: This is the number of times delayCallbacks() has been called without a matching call to resumeCallbacks(). While this is greater than zero, effects of triggerCallbacks() will be delayed.

field.name: _frameCallbackAdded
field.description: This variable is false until the handleEnterFrame callback has been added through StageUtils.

field.name: _groupedCallbackToTriggerEntryMap
field.description: This maps a grouped callback function to its corresponding CallbackEntry object containing a trigger function for that callback. A different trigger function is required for each callback because CallbackCollection will only keep one copy of the pointer to any given function.

field.name: _preCallback
field.description: This is the function that gets called immediately before every callback.

field.name: _runCallbacksCompleted
field.description: This flag is used in _runCallbacksImmediately() to detect when a recursive call has completed running all the callbacks.

field.name: _runCallbacksIsPending
field.description: If this is true, it means triggerCallbacks() has been called while delayed was true.

field.name: _runningGroupedCallbacksNow
field.description: This is set to true while grouped callbacks are running.

field.name: _triggeredGroupedCallbackEntryMap
field.description: This Dictionary maps a grouped callback trigger CallbackEntry to a value of true that means the callback was triggered.

field.name: _triggeredGroupedCallbackEntryOrderedList
field.description: This is a list of the grouped CallbackEntry objects in the order they were triggered.

field.name: _wasDisposed
field.description: This value is used internally to remember if dispose() was called.

field.name: allowDelayCallbacks
field.description: If this is set to true, delayCallbacks() behaves as described. Otherwise, delayCallbacks() has no effect.

classRec.name: SessionManager
classRec.description: This is a collection of core functions in the Weave session framework.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: computeDiff
method.description: This function computes the diff of two session states.
method.param: oldState The source session state.
newState The destination session state.
method.return: A patch that generates the destination session state when applied to the source session state, or undefined if the two states are equivalent.

method.name: copySessionState
method.description: This function will copy the session state from one sessioned object to another. If the two objects are of different types, the behavior of this function is undefined.
method.param: source A sessioned object to copy the session state from.
source A sessioned object to copy the session state to.

method.name: disposeObjects
method.description: This function should be called when an ILinkableObject or IDisposableObject is no longer needed.
method.param: object An ILinkableObject or an IDisposableObject to clean up.
moreObjects More objects to clean up.

method.name: getCallbackCollection
method.description: This function gets the ICallbackCollection associated with an ILinkableObject. If there is no ICallbackCollection defined for the object, one will be created. This ICallbackCollection is used for reporting changes in the session state
method.param: linkableObject An ILinkableObject to get the associated ICallbackCollection for.
method.return: The ICallbackCollection associated with the given object.

method.name: getChildPropertyName
method.description: internal use only

method.name: getDescendants
method.description: This function will return all the descendant objects that implement ILinkableObject. If the filter parameter is specified, the results will contain only those objects that extend or implement the filter class.
method.param: root A root object to get the descendants of.
filter An optional Class definition which will be used to filter the results.
method.return: An Array containing a list of descendant objects.

method.name: getLinkableObjectOwner
method.description: This function gets the owner of a linkable object. The owner of an object is defined as its first registered parent.
method.param: child An ILinkableObject that was registered as a child of another ILinkableObject.
method.return: The owner of the child object (the first parent that was registered with the child), or null if the child has no owner.

method.name: getLinkablePropertyNames
method.description: This function gets a list of sessioned property names so accessor functions for non-sessioned properties do not have to be called.
method.param: linkableObject An object containing sessioned properties.
method.return: An Array containing the names of the sessioned properties of that object class.

method.name: getPaths
method.description: This function is for debugging purposes only.

method.name: getRegisteredChildren
method.description: This function will return all the child objects that have been registered with a parent.
method.param: parent A parent object to get the registered children of.
method.return: An Array containing a list of linkable objects that have been registered as children of the specified parent. This list includes all children that have been registered, even those that do not appear in the session state.

method.name: getSessionState
method.param: linkableObject An object containing sessioned properties (sessioned objects may be nested).
method.return: An object containing the values from the sessioned properties.

method.name: internalGetSessionState
method.description: This function is for internal use only.
method.param: sessionedObject An object containing sessioned properties (sessioned objects may be nested).
ignoreList A dictionary that keeps track of which objects this function has already traversed.
method.return: An object containing the values from the sessioned properties.

method.name: isChildInSessionState
method.description: This function checks if a parent-child relationship exists between two ILinkableObjects and the child appears in the session state of the parent.
method.param: parent A suspected parent object.
child A suspected child object.
method.return: true if the child is registered as a child of the parent.

method.name: linkBindableProperty
method.description: linking sessioned objects with bindable properties

method.name: linkSessionState
method.description: internal use only
method.param: child A sessioned object to return siblings for.
filter A Class to filter by (results will only include objects that are of this type).
method.return: An Array of ILinkableObjects having the same parent of the given child.

method.name: newDisposableChild
method.param: disposableParent A parent ILinkableObject to create a new child for.
disposableChildType The class definition that implements ILinkableObject used to create the new child.
method.return: The new child object.

method.name: newLinkableChild
method.param: linkableParent A parent ILinkableObject to create a new child for.
linkableChildType The class definition that implements ILinkableObject used to create the new child.
callback A callback with no parameters that will be added to the child that will run before the parent callbacks are triggered, or during the next ENTER_FRAME event if a grouped callback is used.
useGroupedCallback If this is true, addGroupedCallback() will be used instead of addImmediateCallback().
method.return: The new child object.

method.name: objectWasDisposed
method.description: This function checks if an object has been disposed of by SessionManager.
method.param: object An object to check.
method.return: true if SsessionManager.dispose() was called for the specified object.

method.name: registerDisposableChild
method.param: disposableParent A parent disposable object that the child will be registered with.
disposableChild The disposable object to register as a child of the parent.
method.return: The linkableChild object that was passed to the function.

method.name: registerLinkableChild
method.description:
This function tells the SessionManager that the session state of the specified child should appear in the session state of the specified parent, and the child should be disposed of when the parent is disposed.
There is one other requirement for the child session state to appear in the parent session state -- the child must be accessible through a public variable of the parent or through an accessor function of the parent.
This function will add callbacks to the sessioned children that cause the parent callbacks to run.
If a callback function is given, the callback will be added to the child and cleaned up when the parent is disposed of.
Example usage: public const foo:LinkableNumber = registerLinkableChild(this, someLinkableNumber, handleFooChange);
method.param: linkableParent A parent ILinkableObject that the child will be registered with.
linkableChild The child ILinkableObject to register as a child.
callback A callback with no parameters that will be added to the child that will run before the parent callbacks are triggered, or during the next ENTER_FRAME event if a grouped callback is used.
useGroupedCallback If this is true, addGroupedCallback() will be used instead of addImmediateCallback().
method.return: The linkableChild object that was passed to the function.

method.name: removeLinkableChildFromSessionState
method.description: This function will add or remove child objects from the session state of a parent. Use this function with care because the child will no longer be "sessioned." The child objects will continue to trigger the callbacks of the parent object, but they will no longer be considered a part of the parent's session state. If you are not careful, this will break certain functionalities that depend on the session state of the parent.
method.param: parent A parent that the specified child objects were previously registered with.
child The child object to remove from the session state of the parent.

method.name: setSessionState
method.param: linkableObject An object containing sessioned properties (sessioned objects may be nested).
newState An object containing the new values for sessioned properties in the sessioned object.
removeMissingDynamicObjects If true, this will remove any properties from an ILinkableCompositeObject that do not appear in the session state.

method.name: unlinkBindableProperty
method.description: This function will unlink an ILinkableVariable from a bindable property that has been previously linked with linkBindableProperty().
method.param: linkableVariable An ILinkableVariable to unlink from a bindable property.
bindableParent An object with a bindable property.
bindablePropertyName The variable name of the bindable property.

method.name: unlinkSessionState
method.description: This will unlink the session state of two ILinkableObjects that were previously linked with linkSessionState().
method.param: first The ILinkableObject to unlink from 'second'
second The ILinkableObject to unlink from 'first'

method.name: unregisterLinkableChild
method.description: Use this function with care. This will remove child objects from the session state of a parent and stop the child from triggering the parent callbacks.
method.param: parent A parent that the specified child objects were previously registered with.
child The child object to unregister from the parent.

field.name: _changeWatcherMap
field.description: This is a multidimensional mapping, such that _changeWatcherMap[linkableVariable][bindableParent][bindablePropertyName] maps to a ChangeWatcher object.

field.name: _changeWatcherToCopyFunctionMap
field.description: This maps a ChangeWatcher object to a function that was added as a callback to the corresponding ILinkableVariable.

field.name: childToOwnerMap
field.description: This maps a child ILinkableObject to its registered owner.

field.name: childToParentDictionaryMap
field.description: This maps a child ILinkableObject to a Dictionary, which maps each of its registered parent ILinkableObjects to a value of true. Example: childToParentDictionaryMap[child][parent] == true

field.name: classNameToDeprecatedSetterNamesMap
field.description: This maps a qualified class name to an Array of names of deprecated setter functions contained in that class.

field.name: classNameToSessionedPropertyNamesMap
field.description: This maps a qualified class name to an Array of names of sessioned properties contained in that class.

field.name: linkableObjectToCallbackCollectionMap
field.description: This maps an ILinkableObject to a ICallbackCollection associated with it.

field.name: linkedObjectsDictionaryMap
field.description: This maps a sessioned object to a Dictionary, which maps a linked sessioned object to a value of true.

field.name: objectToSetterMap
field.description: This maps an destination ILinkableObject to a function like: function(source:ILinkableObject):void { setSessionState(destination, getSessionState(source), true); } The purpose of having this mapping is to have a different function pointer for each ILinkableObject so addImmediateCallback() and removeCallback() can be used to link and unlink overlapping pairs of ILinkableObject objects.

field.name: ownerToChildDictionaryMap
field.description: This maps a parent ILinkableObject to a Dictionary, which maps each child ILinkableObject it owns to a value of true.

field.name: parentToChildDictionaryMap
field.description: This maps a parent ILinkableObject to a Dictionary, which maps each of its registered child ILinkableObjects to a value of true. Example: parentToChildDictionaryMap[parent][child] == true

field.name: runningDebugFlashPlayer
field.description: This value is true if the user is running the debug version of the flash player.

classRec.name: LinkableVariable
classRec.description: LinkableVariable allows callbacks to be added that will be called when the value changes. A LinkableVariable has an optional type restriction on the values it holds.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: LinkableVariable
method.description: This constructor does not allow an initial value to be specified, because no other class has a pointer to this object until the constructor completes, which means the value cannot be retrieved during any callbacks that would run in the constructor. This forces the developer to set default values outside the constructor of the LinkableVariable, which means the callbacks will run the first time the value is set. This behavior is desirable because it allows the initial value to be handled by the same code that handles new values.
method.param: sessionStateType The type of values accepted for this sessioned property.
verifier A function that returns true or false to verify that a value is accepted as a session state or not. The function signature should be function(value::Boolean.

method.name: isUndefined
method.description: isUndefined
method.return: true if the session state is considered undefined.

method.name: lock
method.description: lock Call this function when you do not want to allow any more changes to the value of this sessioned property.

method.name: sessionStateEquals
method.description: valueEquals This function is used in setSessionState() to determine if the value has changed or not. Classes that extend this class may override this function.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: Unless callbacks have been delayed with delayCallbacks(), this function will update _value and run callbacks. If this is not the first time setSessionState() is called and the new value equals the current value, this function has no effect.
method.param: value The new value. If the value given is of the wrong type, the value will be set to null.

field.name: _locked
field.description: locked This is set to true when lock() is called. Subsequent calls to setSessionState() will have no effect.

field.name: _sessionStateWasSet
field.description: _sessionStateWasSet This is true if the session state has been set at least once.

field.name: _verifier
field.description: This function is used to prevent the session state from having unwanted values. Function signature should be function(value::Boolean

classRec.name: LinkableXML
classRec.description: LinkableBoolean, LinkableString and LinkableNumber contain simple, immutable data types. LinkableXML is an exception because it contains an XML object that can be manipulated. Changes to the internal XML object cannot be detected automatically, so a detectChanges() function is provided. However, if two LinkableXML objects have the same internal XML object, modifying the internal XML of one object would inadvertently modify the internal XML of another. To avoid this situation, LinkableXML creates a copy of the XML that you set as the session state.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: detectChanges
method.description: This function will run the callbacks attached to this LinkableXML if the session state has changed. This function should be called if the XML is modified without calling set value() or setSessionState().

method.name: saveXMLString
method.description: This function gets called as the first callback and saves the current XML as a String for later comparisons.

method.name: sessionStateEquals
method.param: otherSessionState Another session state to compare with the session state of this object.
method.return: true if the other session state is equal to the session state previously set.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: If this function receives a String, it will try to cast as an XML before saving it. If this function receives an XML, it will save a copy instead of the original.
method.param: value The new sessioned XML value to copy.

method.name: value
method.description: This is the sessioned XML value for this object.

method.name: value
method.description: This will save a COPY of the value passed in to prevent multiple LinkableXML objects from having the same internal XML object.
method.param: value An XML to copy and save as the sessioned value for this object.

field.name: _prevStateString
field.description: This is used to store the result of toXMLString() on the session state whenever it changes. This value is used when comparing to other session states.

classRec.name: LinkableBoolean
classRec.description: LinkableBoolean
classRec.author: adufilie

classRec.author: adufilie

classRec.name: LinkableNumber

classRec.name: UntypedLinkableVariable
classRec.description: UntypedLinkableVariable This is a LinkableVariable that adds "get value" and "set value" functions for untyped values.

classRec.name: LinkableHashMap
classRec.description: This contains an ordered list of name-to-object mappings.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: LinkableHashMap
method.param: typeRestriction If specified, this will limit the type of objects that can be added to this LinkableHashMap.

method.name: copyObject
method.description: This function will copy the session state of an ILinkableObject to an object under the given name in this LinkableHashMap.
method.param: newName A name for the object to be initialized in this LinkableHashMap.
objectToCopy An object to copy the session state from.
method.return: The new copy of the specified object, or null if an error occurred.

method.name: createAndSaveNewObject
method.description: (private)
method.param: name The identifying name to associate with a new object.
classDef The Class definition used to instantiate a new object.

method.name: dispose
method.description: This function removes all objects from this LinkableHashMap.

method.name: generateUniqueName
method.description: This will generate a new name for an object that is different from all the names of objects previously used in this LinkableHashMap.
method.param: baseName The name to start with. If the name is already in use, an integer will be appended to create a unique name.

method.name: getName
method.param: object An object contained in this LinkableHashMap.
method.return: The name associated with the object, or null if the object was not found.

method.name: getNames
method.param: filter If specified, names of objects that are not of this type will be filtered out.
method.return: A copy of the ordered list of names of objects contained in this LinkableHashMap.

method.name: getObject
method.param: name The identifying name to associate with an object.
method.return: The object associated with the given name.

method.name: getObjects
method.param: filter If specified, objects that are not of this type will be filtered out.
method.return: An ordered Array of objects that correspond to the names returned by getNames(filter).

method.name: getSessionState
method.return: An Array of DynamicState objects which compose the session state for this object.

method.name: initObjectByClassName
method.description: If there is an existing object associated with the specified name, it will be kept if it is the specified type, or replaced with a new instance of the specified type if it is not.
method.param: name The identifying name of a new or existing object. If this is null, a new one will be generated.
className The qualified class name of the desired object type.
lockObject If this is set to true, lockObject() will be called on the given name.
method.return: The object associated with the given name, or null if an error occurred.

method.name: lock
method.description: This function will call lockObject() on all objects in this LinkableHashMap. The LinkableHashMap will also be locked so that no new objects can be initialized.

method.name: lockObject
method.description: This function will lock an object in place for a given identifying name. If there is no object using the specified name, this function will have no effect.
method.param: name The identifying name of an object to lock in place.

method.name: removeAllObjects
method.description: This function attempts to removes all objects from this LinkableHashMap. Any objects that are locked will remain.

method.name: removeObject
method.param: name The identifying name of an object previously saved with setObject().

method.name: requestObject
method.description: This function creates an object in the hash map if it doesn't already exist. If there is an existing object associated with the specified name, it will be kept if it is the specified type, or replaced with a new instance of the specified type if it is not.
method.param: name The identifying name of a new or existing object.
classDef The Class of the desired object type.
lockObject If this is true, the object will be locked in place under the specified name.
method.return: The object under the requested name of the requested type, or null if an error occurred.

method.name: setNameOrder
method.description: This will reorder the names returned by getNames() and the objects returned by getObjects(). Any names appearing in newOrder that do not appear in getNames() will be ignored. Callbacks will be called if the new child order differs from the old order.
method.param: newOrder The new desired ordering of names and their corresponding objects.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: This function will update the list of child objects based on an absolute or incremental session state.
method.param: newState An Array of child name Strings or DynamicState objects containing the new values and types for child objects.
removeMissingDynamicObjects If true, this will remove any child objects that do not appear in the session state.

method.name: childListCallbacks
method.description: This is an interface for adding and removing callbacks that will get triggered immediately when an object is added or removed.
method.return: An interface for adding callbacks that get triggered when the list of child objects changes.

classRec.name: LinkableWrapper
classRec.description: This is a wrapper for a dynamically created object that does not have to implement ILinkableObject.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: handleSessionStateChange
method.description: This function will update the generatedObject using the current session state.

method.name: updateObject
method.description: This updates an existing object, changing the type if necessary and setting the properties.
method.param: object The existing object to update.
newType The desired object type.
newProperties The new values for the properties of the object.
method.return: The existing object or a new one of the desired type.

method.name: generatedObject
method.description: This is the object that was generated from the session state.

classRec.name: LinkableDynamicObject
classRec.description: This object links to an internal ILinkableObject. The internal object can be either a local one or a global one identified by a global name.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: childListCallback
method.description: This function will be called when the _localHashMap runs its child list callbacks. This callback is needed in case _localHashMap is manipulated directly via getLinkableObjectOwner().

method.name: copyLocalObject
method.description: This function will copy the session state of an ILinkableObject to the local internalObject.
method.param: objectToCopy An object to copy the session state from.

method.name: dispose
method.description: This function gets called by SessionManager.dispose().

method.name: getObject
method.description: This function gets the internal object, whether local or global.
method.return: The internal, dynamically created object.

method.name: getSessionState
method.description: This gets the session state of this object.
method.return: An Array of DynamicState objects which compose the session state for this object.

method.name: handleGlobalListChange
method.description: This function manages pointers to linked global objects when those objects get added or removed from the global object map.

method.name: lock
method.description: This function will call lockObject() on the ILinkableHashMap that contains the internal object. This object will also be locked so that no new objects can be requested.

method.name: removeObject
method.description: If the internal object is local, this will remove the object (unless it is locked). If the internal object is global, this will remove the link to it.

method.name: requestGlobalObject
method.description: This function creates a global object using the given Class definition if it doesn't already exist. If the object gets disposed of later, this object will still be linked to the global name. If the existing object under the specified name is locked, this function does nothing.
method.param: name The name of the global object to link to.
objectType The Class used to initialize the object.
lockObject If this is true, this object will be locked so the internal object cannot be removed or replaced.
method.return: The global object of the specified name and type, or null if the object could not be created.

method.name: requestLocalObject
method.description: This function creates a local object using the given Class definition if it doesn't already exist. If the existing object is locked, this function does nothing.
method.param: objectType The Class used to initialize the object.
lockObject If this is true, this object will be locked so the internal object cannot be removed or replaced.
method.return: The local object of the specified type, or null if the object could not be created.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: This sets the session state of this object.
method.param: newStateArray An Array of DynamicState objects containing the new values and types for child objects.
removeMissingDynamicObjects If true, this will remove any child objects that do not appear in the session state.

method.name: globalHashMap
method.description: This is the mapping from global names to objects.

method.name: globalName
method.description: This is the name of the linked global object.

method.name: internalObject
method.description: This is the local or global internal object.

method.name: globalName
method.description: This function will change the internalObject if the new globalName is different. If a new global name is given, the session state of the new global object will take precedence.
method.param: newGlobalName This is the name of the global object to link to, or null to unlink from the current global object.

classRec.name: SessionStateLog
classRec.description: This class saves the session history of an ILinkableObject.
classRec.author: adufilie

classRec.name: LinkableDisplayObject
classRec.description: This is an generic wrapper for a dynamically created DisplayObject.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: addEventListeners
method.description: This function adds the event listeners to the internal DisplayObject.

method.name: generateEventListener
method.description: This function generates an event listener that executes JavaScript code.
method.param: script The JavaScript code.
method.return: An event listener that runs the JavaScript code.

method.name: handleClassDefChange
method.description: This function updates the type of the internal DisplayObject.

method.name: handlePropertiesChange
method.description: This function updates the properties on the internal DisplayObject.

method.name: removeEventListeners
method.description: This function removes the event listeners from the internal DisplayObject.

method.name: updateEventListeners
method.description: This function updates the event listeners on the internal DisplayObject.

method.name: dbmsList

sanbalag

method.name: convertParamsObjectToQueryParamArray
method.description: convertParamsObjectToQueryParamArray A params object is easier to deal with in flex, but a params array is used as the webservice parameter type. This function provides a translation.
method.param: params An object like {year: "1994"}
method.return: An Array of QueryParam objects mapping variable names to string values.

method.description: Get the vertices.

method.return: True if this is a line.

method.name: isPoint

method.description: This function tests if a IQualifiedKey object is contained in this IKeySet.

interfaceRec.name: IProgressIndicator
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for a central location to report progress of asynchronous requests. Since this interface extends ILinkableObject, getCallbackCollection() can be used on an IProgressIndicator.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: addTask
method.description: This function will register a pending request token and increase the pendingRequestCount if necessary.
method.param: taskToken The object whose progress to track.

method.name: getNormalizedProgress
method.description: This function checks the overall progress of all pending requests.
method.return: A Number between 0 and 1.

method.name: getTaskCount
method.description: This is the number of pending requests.

method.name: removeTask
method.description: This function will remove a previously registered pending request token and decrease the pendingRequestCount if necessary.
method.param: taskToken The object to remove from the progress indicator.

method.name: updateTask
method.description: This function will report the current progress of a request.
method.param: taskToken The object whose progress to track.
percent The current progress of the token's request.

interfaceRec.name: ICSVParser
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for parsing and generating valid CSV data.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: convertRecordsToRows
method.description: This function converts an Array of Objects (compatible with DataGrid) to an Array of Arrays compatible with other functions in this class.
method.param: records An Array of Objects containing String properties.
columnOrder An optional list of column names to use in order.
allowBlankColumns If this is set to true, then the function will include all columns even if they are blank.
method.return: An Array of Arrays, the first being a header line containing all the property names.

method.name: convertRowsToRecords
method.description: This function converts an Array of Arrays to an Array of Objects compatible with DataGrid.
method.param: rows An Array of Arrays, the first being a header line containing property names
method.return: An Array of Objects containing String properties using the names in the header line.

method.name: getRecordFieldNames
method.description: This function returns a comprehensive list of all the field names defined by a list of record objects.
method.param: records An Array of record objects.
includeNullFields If this is true, fields that have null values will be included.
method.return: A comprehensive list of all the field names defined by the given record objects.

method.name: parseCSV
method.param: csvData The CSV string to parse.
parseTokens If this is true, tokens surrounded in quotes will be unquoted and escaped characters will be unescaped.
method.return: The destination Array, or a new Array if none was specified. The result of parsing the CSV string will be stored here.

interfaceRec.name: IColumnWrapper
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for a column that is a wrapper for another column. The data should always be retrieved from the wrapper class because the getValueFromKey() function may modify the data before returning it. The purpose of this interface is to allow you to check the type of the internal column. One example usage of this is to check if the internal column is a StreamedGeometryColumn so that you can request more detail from the tile service.
