method.return: An IAttributeColumn object that will be updated when the column data downloads.

method.name: initializeHierarchySubtree
method.description: initializeHierarchySubtree
method.param: subtreeNode A node in the hierarchy representing the root of the subtree to initialize, or null to initialize the root of the hierarchy.

method.name: attributeHierarchy
method.description: TODO: Instead of XML, this should be a hierarchy of IColumnReference objects that can be passed to getAttributeColumn().
method.return: An AttributeHierarchy object that will be updated when new pieces of the hierarchy are filled in.

interfaceRec.name: IDynamicKeyFilter
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for dynamically creating an IKeyFilter.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

interfaceRec.name: IColumnReference
interfaceRec.description: A column reference contains all the information required to retrieve a column of data. This interface requires a function to get a hash value for the column reference that can be used to tell if two references are equal.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getDataSource
method.description: This function returns the IDataSource that knows how to get the column this object refers to.
method.return: The IDataSource that can be used to retrieve the column that this object refers to.

method.name: getHashCode
method.description: This function gets a hash code that can be used to compare two IColumnReference objects for equality.
method.return: The hash code for comparing two IColumnReferences.

method.name: getMetadata
method.description: This function gets metadata associated with the column. For standard metadata property names, refer to the AttributeColumnMetadata class.
method.param: propertyName The name of the metadata property to retrieve.
method.result: The value of the specified metadata property.

interfaceRec.name: IQualifiedKeyManager
interfaceRec.description:
This class manages a global list of IQualifiedKey objects.
The getQKey() function must be used to get IQualifiedKey objects. Each QKey returned by getQKey() with the same parameters will be the same object, so IQualifiedKeys can be compared with the == operator or used as keys in a Dictionary.
The callbacks for this class should be triggered whenever a new key is created.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getAllKeyTypes
method.description: Get a list of all previoused key types.
method.return: An array of QKeys.

method.name: getAllQKeys
method.description: Get a list of all referenced QKeys for a given key type
method.return: An array of QKeys

method.name: getCompatibleKeyTypes
method.description: This function returns an array of key types (Strings) for which there exist mappings to or from the given key type.
method.param: keyType A key type.
method.return: A list of compatible types.

method.name: getKeyMappings
method.description: This function returns an Array of IColumnReference objects that refer to columns that provide a mapping from one key type to another.
method.param: sourceKeyType The desired input key type.
destinationKeyType The desired output key type.
method.return: An Array of IColumnReference objects that refer to columns that provide a mapping from the source key type to the destination key type.

method.name: getQKey
method.description: Get the QKey object for a given key type and key.
method.return: The QKey object for this type and key.

method.name: getQKeys
method.description: Get a list of QKey objects, all with the same key type.
method.return: An array of QKeys.

method.name: registerKeyMapping
method.description: This function should be called to register a column as a key mapping between two key types.
method.param: column A reference to the column that maps keys of one key type to corresponding keys of another type.

interfaceRec.name: IProjectionManager
interfaceRec.description: An interface for reprojecting columns of geometries and individual coordinates.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getProjectedGeometryColumn
method.description: This function will return a column containing reprojected geometries.
method.param: sourceColumn A reference to a column containing geometry data.
destinationSRS The string corresponding to a projection destination.
method.return: The reprojected geometry column.

method.name: getProjector
method.description: This function will return an IProjector object that can be used to reproject points.
method.param: sourceSRS The SRS code of the source projection.
destinationSRS The SRS code of the destination projection.
method.return: An IProjector object that reprojects from sourceSRS to destinationSRS.

method.name: projectionExists
method.description: This function will check if a projection is defined for a given SRS code.
method.param: srsCode The SRS code of the projection.
method.return: A boolean indicating true if the projection is defined and false otherwise.

method.name: transformBounds
method.description: This function will approximately transform bounds from the sourceSRS to the destinationSRS.
method.param: sourceSRS The SRS code of the source projection.
destinationSRS The SRS code of the destination projection.
inputAndOutput The bounds to transform. This is then used as the return value.
xGridSize The x dimension of the grid used to approximate the transform.
yGridSize The y dimension of the grid used to approximate the transform.
method.return: The transformed bounds, inputAndOutput.

method.name: transformPoint
method.description: This function will transform a point from the sourceSRS to the destinationSRS.
method.param: sourceSRS The SRS code of the source projection.
destinationSRS The SRS code of the destination projection.
inputAndOutput The point to transform. This is then used as the return value.
method.return: The transformed point, inputAndOutput, or null if the transform failed.

interfaceRec.name: IFilteredKeySet
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for a set of filtered keys.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: keyFilter
method.return: The filter that is applied to the base key set.

interfaceRec.name: IAttributeColumnCache
interfaceRec.description: This is a cache that maps IColumnReference hash values to IAttributeColumns. The getAttributeColumn() function is used to avoid making duplicate column requests.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getColumn
method.description: This function will return the same IAttributeColumn for two IColumnReference objects having the same hash value. Use this function to avoid duplicate data downloads.
method.param: columnReference A reference to a column.
method.return: The column that the reference refers to.

interfaceRec.name: IDataRowSource
interfaceRec.description: This is a generic interface for getting rows of data from a source.
interfaceRec.author: kmanohar

interfaceRec.name: IExternalSessionStateInterface
interfaceRec.description:
This interface is a set of functions intended to be exposed as an external JavaScript API.
The user interface in Weave is initially generated from a saved session state. User interactions affect the session state, and changes in the session state affect the display at runtime. The API provides a window into the session state so most interactions that can be made through the GUI can also be made through JavaScript calls.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: convertSessionStateObjectToXML
method.description: This function serializes a session state from Object format to XML String format.
method.param: sessionState A session state object.
tagName The name to use for the root XML tag that gets generated from the session state.
method.return: An XML serialization of the session state.

method.name: convertSessionStateXMLToObject
method.description: This function converts a session state from XML format to Object format. Nested XML objects will be converted to Strings before returning.
method.param: sessionState A session state that has been encoded in XML. This can be supplied as either an XML object or a String.
method.return: The deserialized session state object.

method.name: getChildNames
method.description: This function gets a list of names of children of an object appearing in the session state.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: An Array of names of sessioned children of the object referred to by objectPath, or null if the object doesn't exist.

method.name: getObjectType
method.description: This function will get the qualified class name of an object appearing in the session state.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: The qualified class name of the object referred to by objectPath.

method.name: getSessionState
method.description: This function gets the current session state of a linkable object. Nested XML objects will be converted to Strings before returning.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: An object containing the values from the sessioned properties.

method.name: removeObject
method.description: This function will remove a dynamically created object if it is the child of an ILinkableCompositeObject.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
method.return: true if objectPath refers to a valid location where dynamically created objects can exist.

method.name: requestObject
method.description: This function will dynamically create an object at the specified location in the session state if its parent implements ILinkableCompositeObject. If the object at the specified location already exists and is of the requested type, this function does nothing. If the parent of the dynamic object to be created implements ILinkableHashMap, a value of null for the child name will cause a new name to be generated. If the parent of the dynamic object to be created implements ILinkableDynamicObject, the name of the child refers to the name of a static object appearing at the top level of the session state. A child name equal to null in this case will create a local object that does not appear at the top level of the session state.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
objectType The qualified name of a class implementing ILinkableObject.
method.return: true if, after calling this function, an object of the requested type exists at the requested location.

method.name: setChildNameOrder
method.description: This function will reorder children of an object implementing ILinkableHashMap.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
orderedChildNames The new order to use for the children of the object specified by objectPath.
method.return: true if objectPath refers to the location of an ILinkableHashMap.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: This function updates the current session state of an object.
method.param: objectPath A sequence of child names used to refer to an object appearing in the session state.
newState An object containing the new values for sessioned properties in the sessioned object.
removeMissingDynamicObjects If true, this will remove any properties from an ILinkableCompositeObject that do not appear in the new session state.
method.return: true if objectPath refers to an existing object in the session state.

interfaceRec.name: ICallbackInterface
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for adding and removing callback functions.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: addGroupedCallback
method.description: This function will add a callback that will be delayed except during a scheduled time each frame. Grouped callbacks use a central trigger list, meaning that if multiple CallbackCollections trigger the same grouped callback before the scheduled time, it will behave as if it were only triggered once. Adding a grouped callback to a CallbackCollection will replace any previous effects of addImmediateCallback() or addGroupedCallback() made to the same CallbackCollection. The callback function will not be called recursively as a result of it triggering callbacks recursively.
method.param: relevantContext If this is not null, then the callback will be removed when the relevantContext object is disposed via SessionManager.dispose(). This parameter is typically a 'this' pointer.
groupedCallback The callback function that will only be allowed to run during a scheduled time each frame. It must not require any parameters.
triggerCallbackNow If this is set to true, the callback will be triggered to run during the scheduled time after it is added.

method.name: addImmediateCallback
method.description: This function will add a callback using the given function and parameters. Any callback previously added for the same function will be overwritten. The callback function will not be called recursively as a result of it triggering callbacks recursively.
method.param: relevantContext If this is not null, then the callback will be removed when the relevantContext object is disposed via SessionManager.dispose(). This parameter is typically a 'this' pointer.
callback The function to call when callbacks are triggered.
parameters An array of parameters that will be used as parameters to the callback function.
runCallbackNow If this is set to true, the callback will be run immediately after it is added.

method.name: removeCallback
method.description: This function will remove a callback that was previously added.
method.param: callback The function to remove from the list of callbacks.

method.name: callbacksWereTriggered
method.description: This flag is true between the time that callbacks are triggered and the time immediate callbacks finish being called. It is necessary in some situations to check this flag to determine if cached data should be used.

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableObject
interfaceRec.description: An object that implements this empty interface has an associated ICallbackCollection and session state, accessible through the global functions in the weave.api package. In order for an ILinkableObject to be created dynamically at runtime, it must not require any constructor parameters.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableVariable
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for a primitive ILinkableObject that implements its own session state definition.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getSessionState
method.description: This gets the value of this linkable variable.
method.return: The session state of this object.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: This sets the value of this linkable variable. The implementation of the object determines how to handle unexpected values.
method.param: value The new session state for this object.

interfaceRec.name: IChildListCallbackInterface
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for adding and removing callbacks that get triggered when a child object is added or removed. The accessor functions in this interface return values that are only defined while immediate callbacks are running, not during grouped callbacks.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: lastNameAdded
method.description: This is the name of the object that was added prior to running immediate callbacks.

method.name: lastNameRemoved
method.description: This is the name of the object that was removed prior to running immediate callbacks.

method.name: lastObjectAdded
method.description: This is the object that was added prior to running immediate callbacks.

method.name: lastObjectRemoved
method.description: This is the object that was removed prior to running immediate callbacks.

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableDisplayObject
interfaceRec.description:
This is an interface for an ILinkableObject that is a wrapper for a DisplayObject.
Implementations of this interface should do the following: Callbacks should be triggered when the internal DisplayObject is created or removed. The parent passed to the setParentContainer() function should be remembered and the internal DisplayObject should be added as a child of that parent if the child is created later. The internal DisplayObject should be removed from the parent when the dispose() function is called.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getDisplayObject
method.description: This function gets the DisplayObject this objects is a wrapper for.
method.return: The internal DisplayObject.

method.name: setParentContainer
method.description: This function will set the DisplayObjectContainer that the DisplayObject should be added to. This function should be used instead of parent.addChild() because the internal DisplayObject may change.
method.param: parent The parent DisplayObjectContainer.

interfaceRec.name: IErrorManager
interfaceRec.description: This class is a central location for reporting and detecting errors. The callbacks for the IErrorManager get called when an error is reported.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: reportError
method.description: This function is intended to be the global error reporting mechanism for Weave.

method.name: errors
method.description: This is the list of all previous errors.

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableCompositeObject
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface to a composite object with dynamic state, meaning child objects can be dynamically added or removed. The session state for this type of object is defined as an Array of DynamicState objects. DynamicState objects are defined as having exactly three properties: objectName, className, and sessionState.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getSessionState
method.description: This gets the session state of this composite object.
method.return: An Array of DynamicState objects which compose the session state for this object.

method.name: setSessionState
method.description: This sets the session state of this composite object.
method.param: newState An Array of DynamicState objects defining child ILinkableObjects.
removeMissingDynamicObjects If true, this will remove any child objects that do not appear in the session state.

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableHashMap
interfaceRec.description: This is the interface for an ordered list of name-to-object mappings.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: copyObject
method.description: This function will copy the session state of an ILinkableObject to an object under the given name in this LinkableHashMap.
method.param: newName A name for the object to be initialized in this LinkableHashMap.
objectToCopy An object to copy the session state from.
method.return: The new copy of the specified object, or null if an error occurred.

method.name: generateUniqueName
method.description: This will generate a new name for an object that is different from all the names of objects in this LinkableHashMap.
method.param: baseName The name to start with. If the name is already in use, an integer will be appended to create a unique name.

method.name: getName
method.description: This function gets the name of the specified object in the hash map.
method.param: object An object contained in this LinkableHashMap.
method.return: The name associated with the object, or null if the object was not found.

method.name: getNames
method.description: This function returns an ordered list of names in the hash map.
method.param: filter If specified, names of objects that are not of this type will be filtered out.
method.return: A copy of the ordered list of names of objects contained in this LinkableHashMap.

method.name: getObject
method.description: This function gets the object associated with the specified name.
method.param: name The identifying name to associate with an object.
method.return: The object associated with the given name.

method.name: getObjects
method.description: This function returns an ordered list of objects in the hash map.
method.param: filter If specified, objects that are not of this type will be filtered out.
method.return: An ordered Array of objects that correspond to the names returned by getNames(filter).

method.name: lock
method.description: This function will call lockObject() on all objects in this LinkableHashMap. The LinkableHashMap will also be locked so that no new objects can be initialized.

method.name: removeAllObjects
method.description: This function attempts to removes all objects from this LinkableHashMap. Any objects that are locked will remain.

method.name: removeObject
method.description: This function removes an object from the hash map.
method.param: name The identifying name of an object previously saved with setObject().

method.name: requestObject
method.description: This function creates an object in the hash map if it doesn't already exist. If there is an existing object associated with the specified name, it will be kept if it is the specified type, or replaced with a new instance of the specified type if it is not.
method.param: name The identifying name of a new or existing object.
classDef The Class of the desired object type.
lockObject If this is true, the object will be locked in place under the specified name.
method.return: The object under the requested name of the requested type, or null if an error occurred.

method.name: setNameOrder
method.description: This will reorder the names returned by getNames(). Any names appearing in newOrder that do not appear in getNames() will be ignored. Callbacks will be called if the new name order differs from the old order.
method.param: newOrder The new desired ordering of names.

method.name: childListCallbacks
method.description: This is an interface for adding and removing callbacks that will get triggered immediately when an object is added or removed.
method.return: An interface for adding callbacks that get triggered when the list of child objects changes.

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableDynamicObject
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for a wrapper around a dynamically created ILinkableObject.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: copyLocalObject
method.description: This function will copy the session state of an ILinkableObject to the local internalObject.
method.param: objectToCopy An object to copy the session state from.

method.name: lock
method.description: This function will lock the internal object in place so it will not be removed.

method.name: removeObject
method.description: If the internal object is local, this will remove the object (unless it is locked). If the internal object is global, this will remove the link to it.

method.name: requestGlobalObject
method.description: This function creates a global object using the given Class definition if it doesn't already exist. If the object gets disposed of later, this object will still be linked to the global name. If the existing object under the specified name is locked, this function will not modify it.
method.param: name The name of the global object to link to.
objectType The Class used to initialize the object.
lockObject If this is true, this object will be locked so the internal object cannot be removed or replaced.
method.return: The global object of the requested name and type, or null if the object could not be created.

method.name: requestLocalObject
method.description: This function creates a local object using the given Class definition if it doesn't already exist. If this object is locked, this function does nothing.
method.param: objectType The Class used to initialize the object.
lockObject If this is true, this object will be locked so the internal object cannot be removed or replaced.
method.return: The local object of the requested type, or null if the object could not be created.

method.name: globalName
method.description: This is the name of the linked global object, or null if the internal object is local.

method.name: internalObject
method.description: This function gets the internal object, whether local or global.
method.return: The internal, dynamically created object.

method.name: globalName
method.description: This function will change the internalObject if the new globalName is different, unless this object is locked. If a new global name is given, the session state of the new global object will take precedence.
method.param: newGlobalName This is the name of the global object to link to, or null to unlink from the current global object.

interfaceRec.name: ICallbackCollection
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for adding and removing callback functions, and triggering them.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: delayCallbacks
method.description: This will increase the delay count by 1. To decrease the delay count, use resumeCallbacks(). As long as the delay count is greater than zero, effects of triggerCallbacks() will be delayed.

method.name: resumeCallbacks
method.description: This will decrease the delay count if it is greater than zero. If triggerCallbacks() was called while the delay count was greater than zero, immediate callbacks will be called now.
method.param: undoAllDelays If this is set to true, the delay count will be set to zero. Otherwise, the delay count will be decreased by one.

method.name: triggerCallbacks
method.description: This will trigger every callback function to be called with their saved arguments. If the delay count is greater than zero, the callbacks will not be called immediately.

method.name: callbacksAreDelayed
method.description: While this is true, it means the delay count is greater than zero and the effects of triggerCallbacks() are delayed until resumeCallbacks() is called to reduce the delay count.

interfaceRec.name: ISessionManager
interfaceRec.description: This is a collection of static core functions for Weave.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: computeDiff
method.description: This function computes the diff of two session states.
method.param: oldState The source session state.
newState The destination session state.
method.return: A patch that generates the destination session state when applied to the source session state, or undefined if the two states are equivalent.

method.name: copySessionState
method.description: This function will copy the session state from one sessioned object to another. If the two objects are of different types, the behavior of this function is undefined.
method.param: source A sessioned object to copy the session state from.
source A sessioned object to copy the session state to.

method.name: disposeObjects
method.description: This function should be called when an ILinkableObject or IDisposableObject is no longer needed.
method.param: object An ILinkableObject or an IDisposableObject to clean up.
moreObjects More objects to clean up.

method.name: getCallbackCollection
method.description: This function gets the ICallbackCollection associated with an ILinkableObject. If there is no ICallbackCollection defined for the object, one will be created. This ICallbackCollection is used for reporting changes in the session state
method.param: linkableObject An ILinkableObject to get the associated ICallbackCollection for.
method.return: The ICallbackCollection associated with the given object.

method.name: getLinkableObjectOwner
method.description: This function gets the owner of a linkable object. The owner of an object is defined as its first registered parent.
method.param: child An ILinkableObject that was registered as a child of another ILinkableObject.
method.return: The owner of the child object (the first parent that was registered with the child), or null if the child has no owner.

method.name: getSessionState
method.param: linkableObject An object containing sessioned properties (sessioned objects may be nested).
method.return: An object containing the values from the sessioned properties.

method.name: linkBindableProperty
method.description: This function will link the session state of an ILinkableVariable to a bindable property of an object. Prior to linking, the value of the ILinkableVariable will be copied over to the bindable property.
method.param: linkableVariable An ILinkableVariable to link to a bindable property.
bindableParent An object with a bindable property.
bindablePropertyName The variable name of the bindable property.

method.name: linkSessionState
method.description: This will link the session state of two ILinkableObjects. The session state of 'primary' will be copied over to 'secondary' after linking them.
method.param: primary An ILinkableObject to give authority over the initial shared value.
secondary The ILinkableObject to link with 'primary' via session state.

method.name: newDisposableChild
method.description:
This function will create a new instance of the specified child class and register it as a child of the parent. Use this function when a child object can be disposed of but you do not want to link the callbacks. The child will be disposed when the parent is disposed.
Example usage: public const foo:LinkableNumber = newDisposableChild(this, LinkableNumber);
method.param: disposableParent A parent ILinkableObject to create a new child for.
disposableChildType The class definition that implements ILinkableObject used to create the new child.
method.return: The new child object.

method.name: newLinkableChild
method.param: linkableParent A parent ILinkableObject to create a new child for.
linkableChildType The class definition that implements ILinkableObject used to create the new child.
callback A callback with no parameters that will be added to the child that will run before the parent callbacks are triggered, or during the next ENTER_FRAME event if a grouped callback is used.
useGroupedCallback If this is true, addGroupedCallback() will be used instead of addImmediateCallback().
method.return: The new child object.

method.name: registerDisposableChild
method.description:
This will register a child of a parent and cause the child to be disposed when the parent is disposed. Use this function when a child object can be disposed of but you do not want to link the callbacks. The child will be disposed when the parent is disposed.
Example usage: public const foo:LinkableNumber = registerDisposableChild(this, someLinkableNumber);
method.param: disposableParent A parent disposable object that the child will be registered with.
disposableChild The disposable object to register as a child of the parent.
method.return: The linkableChild object that was passed to the function.

method.name: registerLinkableChild
method.description:
This function tells the SessionManager that the session state of the specified child should appear in the session state of the specified parent, and the child should be disposed of when the parent is disposed.
There is one other requirement for the child session state to appear in the parent session state -- the child must be accessible through a public variable of the parent or through an accessor function of the parent.
This function will add callbacks to the sessioned children that cause the parent callbacks to run.
If a callback function is given, the callback will be added to the child and cleaned up when the parent is disposed of.
Example usage: public const foo:LinkableNumber = registerLinkableChild(this, someLinkableNumber, handleFooChange);
method.param: linkableParent A parent ILinkableObject that the child will be registered with.
linkableChild The child ILinkableObject to register as a child.
callback A callback with no parameters that will be added to the child that will run before the parent callbacks are triggered, or during the next ENTER_FRAME event if a grouped callback is used.
useGroupedCallback If this is true, addGroupedCallback() will be used instead of addImmediateCallback().
linkParentCallbacks Normally this parameter is true. If it is false, the callbacks of the child will not trigger the parent callbacks.
method.return: The linkableChild object that was passed to the function.

method.name: setSessionState
method.param: linkableObject An object containing sessioned properties (sessioned objects may be nested).
newState An object containing the new values for sessioned properties in the sessioned object.
removeMissingDynamicObjects If true, this will remove any properties from an ILinkableCompositeObject that do not appear in the session state.

method.name: unlinkBindableProperty
method.description: This function will unlink an ILinkableVariable from a bindable property that has been previously linked with linkBindableProperty().
method.param: linkableVariable An ILinkableVariable to unlink from a bindable property.
bindableParent An object with a bindable property.
bindablePropertyName The variable name of the bindable property.

method.name: unlinkSessionState
method.description: This will unlink the session state of two ILinkableObjects that were previously linked with linkSessionState().
method.param: first The ILinkableObject to unlink from 'second'
second The ILinkableObject to unlink from 'first'

interfaceRec.name: IDisposableObject
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for an object that should be cleaned up when it is no longer needed. It is recommended not to extend IDisposableObject in an interface. Instead, make the implementation of that interface implement IDisposableObject. To dispose of an object in Weave, SessionManager.dispose() should be called instead of directly calling the actual object's dispose function so parent-child relationships get cleaned up automatically.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: dispose
method.description: This function is called when the object is no longer needed. All callbacks and event listeners created by this object should be removed. This function should also be called on any child objects implementing IDisposableObject.

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableContainer
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface to an ILinkableObject that has dynamic children. This interface is intended to be used for a UIComponent that has sessioned UI children.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

classRec.name: ZoomUtils
classRec.description: all-static class containing functions to aid in performing zooming calculations
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: conformDataBoundsToAspectRatio
method.description: conformDataBoundsToAspectRatio Enforce an aspect ratio on xDataUnitsPerPixel to yDataUnitsPerPixel. This will increase the size of the given dataBounds either vertically or horizontally if necessary.
method.param: dataBounds The Bounds2D object to enforce an aspectRatio on.
screenBounds The Bounds2D object the dataBounds will be mapped to.
aspectRatio The aspect ratio to enforce (absolute value will be used).

method.name: generateTransformMatrix
method.description: This function generates a matrix for transforming points from one bounds to another.

method.name: getZoomLevel

classRec.name: ComputationalGeometryUtils
classRec.description: This is a collection of static methods used for common computational geometry problems involving LineSegment, LineRay, Bounds2D, and other objects.
classRec.author: adufilie
kmonico

method.name: getDistanceFromLine
method.description: Compute the distance from the line passing through A and B to the point C. This function assumes the normal from point C to AB lies on AB.
method.param: ax The X coordinate of point A
ay The Y coordinate of point A
bx The X coordinate of point B
by The Y coordinate of point B
cx The X coordinate of point C
cy The Y coordinate of point C
method.return: The distance from the line passing through A and B to the point C

method.name: getDistanceFromPointSq
method.param: ax The X coordinate of point A
ay The Y coordinate of point A
bx The X coordinate of point B
by The Y coordinate of point B
method.return: The distance from point A to point B

method.name: getUnscaledDistanceFromLine
method.description: Compute the unscaled distance from the line to the point. This function should only be used for comparing unscaled distances of other point to line segment distances. This function assumes the normal from point C to AB lies on AB.
method.param: ax The X coordinate of point A
ay The Y coordinate of point A
bx The X coordinate of point B
by The Y coordinate of point B
cx The X coordinate of point C
cy The Y coordinate of point C
method.return: The distance from the line passing through A and B to the point C

method.name: lineIntersectsLine
method.description: This function will determine whether the two lines intersect. An intersection is defined if the line segments cross at one point--if they are parallel or coincidental, the intersection is defined to be false.
method.param: x1 X coordinate of A in AB.
y1 Y coordinate of A in AB.
x2 X coordinate of B in AB.
y2 Y coordinate of B in AB.
x3 X coordinate of E in EF.
y3 Y coordinate of E in EF.
x4 X coordinate of F in EF.
y4 Y coordinate of F in EF.
method.return: A boolean indicating true if the lines intersect, and false otherwise.

method.name: lineIntersectsLine2
method.description: lineIntersectsLine This function computes the intersection point of two lines. Each line can individually be treated as a segment or an infinite line. It is much faster to compute the intersection of infinite lines. The algorithm was taken from the following blogs and optimized for speed: http://keith-hair.net/blog/2008/08/04/find-intersection-point-of-two-lines-in-as3/ http://blog.controul.com/2009/05/line-segment-intersection/
method.param: Ax X coordinate of A in line AB
Ay Y coordinate of A in line AB
Bx X coordinate of B in line AB
By Y coordinate of B in line AB
Ex X coordinate of E in line EF
Ey Y coordinate of E in line EF
Fx X coordinate of F in line EF
Fy Y coordinate of F in line EF
outputIntersectionPoint A Point object to store the intersection coordinates in
ABasSeg true if you want to treat line AB as a segment, false for an infinite line
EFasSeg true if you want to treat line EF as a segment, false for an infinite line
method.return: Either outputIntersectionPoint or a new Point containing the intersection coordinates

method.name: polygonIntersectsLine
method.description: polygonIntersectsLine
method.param: polygon An array of objects representing vertices, each having x and y properties.
Ax X coordinate of A in line AB
Ay Y coordinate of A in line AB
Bx X coordinate of B in line AB
By Y coordinate of B in line AB
asSegment true if you want to treat line AB as a segment, false for an infinite line
method.return: true if the line intersects the polygon

method.name: polygonOverlapsLine
method.param: polygon An array of objects representing vertices, each having x and y properties.
Ax X coordinate of A in line AB
Ay Y coordinate of A in line AB
Bx X coordinate of B in line AB
By Y coordinate of B in line AB
asSegment true if you want to treat line AB as a segment, false for an infinite line
method.return: true if the line overlaps the polygon.

method.name: polygonOverlapsPoint
method.description: polygonOverlapsPoint
method.param: polygon An array of objects representing vertices, each having x and y properties.
x The x coordinate of the point to test for containment.
y The y coordinate of the point to test for containment.
method.return: true if the polygon contains the point.

method.name: polygonOverlapsPolygon
method.description: polygonOverlapsPolygon Optimized for situations where polygon2 is contained in polygon1.
method.param: polygon1 An array of objects representing vertices, each having x and y properties.
polygon2 An array of objects representing vertices, each having x and y properties.
method.return: true if the polygons overlap

method.name: getMedianIndex

firstIndex The index of the first element in the list to calculate a median from.
lastIndex The index of the last element in the list to calculate a median from.
method.return: The index the median element.

method.name: mergeSorted

sortedInputB The second sorted array or vector.
mergedOutput A vector or array to store the merged arrays or vectors.
comparator A function that takes two parameters and returns -1 if the first parameter is less than the second, 0 if equal, or 1 if the first is greater than the second.

method.name: partition

method.param: list An Array or Vector to be re-organized
firstIndex The index of the first element in the list to partition.
lastIndex The index of the first element in the list to partition.
pivotIndex The index of an element to use as a pivot when partitioning.
compareFunction A function that takes two array elements a,b and returns -1 if a<b, 1 if a>b, or 0 if a==b.
method.return: The index the pivot element was moved to during the execution of the function.

method.name: randomSort

classRec.name: ObjectPool
classRec.description: This class contains static functions for pooling reusable objects. The purpose of this class is to avoid unnecessary garbage-collection activity that slows performance. It is recommended that you only use this class for simple, reusable objects that do not contain pointers to other objects. Use this class with care to prevent memory leaks.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: borrowObject
method.description: This function asks the pool for an object with the intention of returning it when it is no longer needed. Be aware that an object from the pool may have values set
method.param: objectType The type of object that you want to get from the pool.
method.return: An object of the requested type from the pool, or a new one if the pool is empty.

method.name: returnObject
method.description: This function tells the ObjectPool that an object is no longer in use and it can go back into the pool so some other code can use it. This function should only be used on objects that you are sure no other code is still using. Also, any object you pass in here should not contain any pointers to other objects. If your code never uses borrowObject(), there is no reason to call returnObject(). If returnObject() is called more often than borrowObject(), that is basically a memory leak.
method.param: object A simple reusable object that is no longer in use.

field.name: pool
field.description: This Dictionary maps a Class definition to a Dictionary whose keys are instances of that class. A Dictionary is used instead of an Array to avoid having multiple pointers to the same object.

method.name: WordProcessingUtilsy
method.param: wordData The string to parse.
index is an object that will serve as a mapping for the words and their frequencies.
method.return: An Array will be returned. This is an array of all the words in the parsed string.

method.name: buildBLGTreeSortMethod
method.description: processVertexChain Sorts points by importance value, removes least important points first.
method.param: firstVertex The first vertex in a chain.
outputCoordinates The BLGTree to store the processed points in.

field.name: tempBounds
field.description: tempBounds Reusable temporary object, helps reduce garbage collection activity.

classRec.name: GeometryStreamDecoder
classRec.description:
This class provides functions for parsing a binary geometry stream. The callbacks for this object get called when all queued decoding completes.
Throughout the code, an ID refers to an integer value, while a Key is a string value. Binary format: tile descriptor format: <float minImportance, float maxImportance, double xMin, double yMin, double xMax, double yMax> stream tile format: <int negativeTileID, binary stream object beginning with positive int, ...> metadata stream object: <int geometryID, String geometryKey, '\0', double xMin, double yMin, double xMax, double yMax, int vertexID1, ..., int vertexID(n), int -1> geometry stream object: <int geometryID1, int vertexID1, int geometryID2, int vertexID2, ..., int geometryID(n-1), int vertexID(n-1), int geometryID(n), int negativeVertexID(n), double x, double y, float importance>
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: decodeGeometryStream
method.description: extracts points from a ByteArray. If the geometries change, the specified callback will run when processing is finished. When decoding completes, decodeCompleteCallbacks will run.

method.name: decodeMetadataStream
method.description: extracts metadata from a ByteArray. If the geometries change, the specified callback will run when processing is finished. When decoding completes, decodeCompleteCallbacks will run.

method.name: decodeMetadataTileList
method.description: decodeMetadataTileList, decodeGeometryTileList, and decodeTileList Converts a base64 string to a ByteArray and extracts tile descriptors, starting with tile #0, then tile #1, etc. When decoding completes, decodeCompleteCallbacks will run.

method.name: delayAddPointParams
method.description: delayAddPointParams This function will store a list of parameters for GeneralizedGeometry.addPoint() to be used later.
method.param: geometryID The ID of the GeneralizedGeometry the addPoint() parameters are for.
vertexID Parameter for GeneralizedGeometry.addPoint().
importance Parameter for GeneralizedGeometry.addPoint().
x Parameter for GeneralizedGeometry.addPoint().
y Parameter for GeneralizedGeometry.addPoint().

method.name: getGeometriesFromKey
method.description: getGeometriesFromKey
method.param: geometryKey A String identifier.
method.return: An Array of GeneralizedGeometry objects with keys matching the specified key.

method.name: getRequiredMetadataTileIDs
method.description: getRequiredMetadataTileIDs, getRequiredGeometryTileIDs, and getRequiredTileIDs These functions return an array of tile IDs that need to be downloaded in order for shapes to be displayed at the given importance (quality) level. IDs of tiles that have already been decoded from a stream will not be returned.
method.return: A list of tile IDs, sorted descending by maxImportance.

method.name: keyType
method.description: This function sets the keyType of the keys that will be added as a result of downloading the geometries.

field.name: IMIN_INDEX
field.description: These constants define indices in a KDKey corresponding to the different KDTree dimensions.

field.name: _currentGeometryType
field.description: currentGeometryType This value specifies the type of the geometries currently being streamed

field.name: _queuedStreamDictionary
field.description: The keys in this dictionary are ByteArray objects that are currently being processed.

field.name: collectiveBounds
field.description: collectiveBounds This is the bounding box containing all tile boundaries.

field.name: geometries
field.description: geometries This is an Array of GeneralizedGeometry objects that have been decoded from a stream.

field.name: idToDelayedAddPointParamsMap
field.description: idToDelayedAddPointParamsMap This maps a geometryID (integer) to an Array of arrays of parameters for GeneralizedGeometry.addPoint(). For example, idToDelayedAddPointParamsMap[3] may be [[vertexID1,importance1,x1,y1],[vertexID2,importance2,x2,y2]].

field.name: keySet
field.description: keySet This is the set of geometry keys that have been decoded so far.

field.name: keyToGeometryMapping
field.description: keyToGeometryMapping This object maps a key to an array of geometries.

field.name: metadataTileIDToKDNodeMapping
field.description: metadataTileIDToKDNodeMapping & geometryTileIDToKDNodeMapping These vectors map a tileID to a KDNode which is used for deleting nodes from the KDTrees.

field.name: metadataTiles
field.description: metadataTiles & geometryTiles These are 6-dimensional trees of tiles that are available and have not been downloaded yet. The dimensions are minImportance, maxImportance, xMin, yMin, xMax, yMax. The objects contained in the KDNodes are integers representing tile ID numbers.

field.name: minKDKey
field.description: These KDKey arrays are created once and reused to avoid unnecessary creation of objects.

field.name: projectionSrsCode
field.description: This is the projection that the coordinates are in. Note: SRS ID means "Spatial Reference System Identifier"

classRec.name: ShpFileReader
classRec.description: The callbacks for this object get called when all queued decoding completes.
classRec.author: adufilie
awilkins

interfaceRec.name: IBounds2D
interfaceRec.description: IBounds2D provides a flexible interface to a Rectangle-like object. The bounds values are stored as xMin,yMin,xMax,yMax instead of x,y,width,height because information is lost when storing as width,height and it causes rounding errors when using includeBounds() & includePoint(), depending on the order you include multiple points.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: centeredResize
method.description: This function will set the width and height to the new values while keeping the center point constant. This function works with both positive and negative values.

method.name: cloneBounds
method.description: This function makes a copy of the IBounds2D object.
method.return: An equivalent copy of this IBounds2D object.

method.name: constrainBounds
method.description: This function will reposition a bounds such that for the x and y dimensions of this bounds and another bounds, at least one bounds will completely contain the other bounds.
method.param: boundsToConstrain the bounds we want to constrain to be within this bounds
preserveSize if set to true, width,height of boundsToConstrain will remain the same

method.name: constrainBoundsCenterPoint
method.description: This constrains the center point of another IBounds2D to be overlapping the center of this IBounds2D.
method.param: boundsToConstrain The IBounds2D objects to constrain.

method.name: constrainPoint
method.description: This constrains a point to be within this IBounds2D.
method.param: point The point to constrain.

method.name: contains
method.description: This function supports a IBounds2D object having negative width & height, unlike the Rectangle object
method.param: x An X coordinate for a point.
y A Y coordinate for a point.
method.return: A value of true if the point is contained within this IBounds2D.

method.name: containsBounds
method.description: This function supports a IBounds2D object having negative width & height, unlike the Rectangle object
method.param: other Another IBounds2D object to check.
method.return: A value of true if the other IBounds2D is contained within this IBounds2D.

method.name: containsPoint
method.description: This function supports a IBounds2D object having negative width & height, unlike the Rectangle object
method.param: point A point to test.
method.return: A value of true if the point is contained within this IBounds2D.

method.name: copyFrom
method.description: This function copies the bounds from another IBounds2D object.
method.param: A IBounds2D object to copy the bounds from.

method.name: equals
method.description: This function compares the IBounds2D with another IBounds2D.
method.param: other Another IBounds2D to compare to
method.return: true if given IBounds2D is equivalent, even if values are undefined

method.name: getArea
method.description: Area is defined as the absolute value of width height.
method.return: The area of the bounds.

method.name: getCenterPoint
method.description: This function stores the xCenter and yCenter coordinates into a Point object.
method.param: value The Point object to store the xCenter and yCenter coordinates in.

method.name: getGridContainment
method.description: Grid numbers correspond to boxes in the following grid: 7 | 6 | 5 --+---+-- 8 | 0 | 4 --+---+-- 1 | 2 | 3 If an x,y point is contained in box 0, it is contained in the IBounds2D object. For example, if a point is contained in box 2, x is within the x-range and y < y-range.
method.param: x The x-coordinate to test for grid containment.
y The y-coordinate to test for grid containment.
method.return: The grid number from 0 to 8 that the x,y point is contained in, or NaN if none.

method.name: getHeight
method.description: The height of the bounds is defined as yMax - yMin.

method.name: getMaxPoint
method.description: This function stores the xMax and yMax coordinates in a Point object.
method.param: output The Point to store the xMax and yMax coordinates in.
method.return: The output Point object.

method.name: getMinPoint
method.description: This function stores the xMin and yMin coordinates in a Point object.
method.param: output The Point to store the xMin and yMin coordinates in.
method.return: The output Point object.

method.name: getRectangle
method.description: This function copies the values from this IBounds2D object into a Rectangle object.
method.param: output A Rectangle to store the result in.
makeSizePositive If true, this will give the Rectangle positive width/height values.
method.return: Either the given output Rectangle, or a new Rectangle if none was specified.

method.name: getWidth
method.description: The width of the bounds is defined as xMax - xMin.

method.name: getXCoverage
method.description: The xCoverage is defined as the absolute value of the width.
method.return: The xCoverage of the bounds.

method.name: getXDirection
method.description: This is equivalent to ObjectUtil.numericCompare(xMax, xMin)

method.name: getXMin
method.description: These are the values defining the bounds.

method.name: getXNumericMax
method.description: The xNumericMax is defined as the maximum of xMin and xMax.
method.return: The numeric maximum x coordinate.

method.name: getXNumericMin
method.description: The xNumericMin is defined as the minimum of xMin and xMax.
method.return: The numeric minimum x coordinate.

method.name: getYCoverage
method.description: The yCoverage is defined as the absolute value of the height.
method.return: The yCoverage of the bounds.

method.name: getYDirection
method.description: This is equivalent to ObjectUtil.numericCompare(yMax, yMin)

method.name: getYNumericMax
method.description: The xNumericMax is defined as the maximum of xMin and xMax.
method.return: The numeric maximum y coordinate.

method.name: getYNumericMin
method.description: The yNumericMin is defined as the minimum of yMin and yMax.
method.return: The numeric minimum y coordinate.

method.name: includeBounds
method.description: This function will expand this IBounds2D to include another IBounds2D.
method.param: otherBounds Another IBounds2D object to include within this IBounds2D.

method.name: includeCoords
method.description: This function will expand this IBounds2D to include a point.
method.param: newX The X coordinate of a point to include in this IBounds2D.
newY The Y coordinate of a point to include in this IBounds2D.

method.name: includePoint
method.description: This function will expand this IBounds2D to include a point.
method.param: newPoint A point to include in this IBounds2D.

method.name: isEmpty
method.description: This function checks if the IBounds2D is empty.
method.return: true if the width or height is 0, or is undefined.

method.name: isUndefined
method.description: This function checks if any coordinates are undefined or infinite.
method.return: true if any coordinate is not a finite number.

method.name: makeSizePositive
method.description: For the x and y dimensions, this function swaps min and max values if min > max.

method.name: projectCoordsTo
method.description: This function projects all four coordinates of a IBounds2D object from this bounds to a destination bounds.
method.param: inputAndOutput A IBounds2D object containing coordinates to project.
toBounds The destination bounds.

method.name: projectPointTo
method.description: This function projects the coordinates of a Point object from this bounds to a destination bounds.
method.param: point The Point object containing coordinates to project.
toBounds The destination bounds.

method.name: reset
method.description: This function resets all coordinates to NaN.

method.name: setBounds
method.description: This function sets the four coordinates that define the bounds.
method.param: xMin The new xMin value.
yMin The new yMin value.
xMax The new xMax value.
yMax The new yMax value.

method.name: setCenter
method.description: This function will shift the bounds coordinates so that the xCenter and yCenter become the specified values.
method.param: xCenter The desired value for xCenter.
yCenter The desired value for yCenter.

method.name: setCenterPoint
method.description: This function will shift the bounds coordinates so that the xCenter and yCenter become the coordinates in a specified Point object.
method.param: value The Point object containing the desired xCenter and yCenter coordinates.

method.name: setHeight
method.description: This function will set the height by adjusting the yMin and yMax values relative to yCenter.
method.param: value The new height value.

method.name: setMaxCoords
method.description: This function sets the xMax and yMax values.
method.param: x The new xMax coordinate.
y The new yMax coordinate.

method.name: setMaxPoint
method.description: This function sets the xMax and yMax values from a Point object.
method.param: value The Point containing new xMax and yMax coordinates.

method.name: setMinCoords
method.description: This function sets the xMin and yMin values.
method.param: x The new xMin coordinate.
y The new yMin coordinate.

method.name: setMinPoint
method.description: This function sets the xMin and yMin values from a Point object.
method.param: value The Point containing new xMin and yMin coordinates.

method.name: setRectangle
method.description: This function sets the bounds coordinates using x, y, width and height values.
method.param: x The new xMin value.
y The new yMin value.
width The new width of the bounds.
height The new height of the bounds.

method.name: setWidth
method.description: This function will set the width by adjusting the xMin and xMax values relative to xCenter.
method.param: value The new width value.

interfaceRec.name: IMatrix
interfaceRec.description: IMatrix provides an interface to a two dimensional array of numbers. Operations allowed on an IMatrix are addition, subtraction, multiplication, and inversion. All of these operations are in-place on this matrix and return this matrix to allow nesting. Uninitialized entries in the array default to 0 to imitate sparse matrices.
interfaceRec.author: kmonico

method.name: add
method.description: This function will add this matrix to the other matrix and store the result in result. this + rightHandSide
method.param: rightHandSide The other matrix.
method.return: This matrix.

method.name: cloneMatrix
method.description: This function will clone this matrix and return the result.
method.param: result The matrix to store the result.
method.return: The cloned matrix, result.

method.name: copyFrom
method.description: This function will copy the entries of the other matrix into this matrix.
method.param: other The other matrix.

method.name: getEntry
method.description: Gets a value at the entry in the matrix specified by row and column.
method.param: row The row of the matrix.
column The column of the matrix.
method.return: The value at the matrix's row, column cell.

method.name: getHeight
method.description: Gets the height of the matrix, which is defined as the number of rows.
method.return: The number of rows.

method.name: getWidth
method.description: Gets the width of the matrix, which is defined as the number of columns.
method.return: The number of columns.

method.name: invert
method.description: This function will invert this matrix.
method.return: This matrix after the inversion.

method.name: multiply
method.description: This function will multiply this matrix to the other matrix and store the result in result. this rightHandSide
method.param: rightHandSide The other matrix.
method.return: This matrix after the multiplication.

method.name: setDimensions
method.description: Sets the dimensions of the matrix.
method.param: rows The new number of rows.
columns The new number of columns.

method.name: setEntry
method.description: Sets a value at the entry in the matrix specified by row and column.
method.param: value The value to set.
row The row of the matrix.
column The column of the matrix.

method.name: subtract
method.description: This function will subtract the other matrix from this one and store the result in result. this - rightHandSide
method.param: rightHandSide The other matrix.
method.return: Tis matrix after the subtraction.

interfaceRec.name: IZoomView
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface for setting the data bounds and screen bounds of a plot.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

interfaceRec.name: ILineStyle
interfaceRec.description: A class implementing ILineStyle defines the properties required to set line styles corresponding to record keys. This interface is meant to be as lightweight and generic as possible.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: beginLineStyle
method.description: This will set the line style on the specified Graphics object using the properties saved in this class.
method.param: recordKey The record key to initialize the fill style for.
graphics The Graphics object to initialize.

interfaceRec.name: ILinkableObjectEditor
interfaceRec.description: This is an interface to a LinkableObject Editor
interfaceRec.author: skolman

interfaceRec.name: ISpatialIndex
interfaceRec.description: NOTE: This is a temporary interface just to get everything working.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

interfaceRec.name: IFillStyle
interfaceRec.description: A class implementing IFillStyle defines the properties required to set fill styles corresponding to record keys. This interface is meant to be as lightweight and generic as possible.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: beginFillStyle
method.description: This will set the fill style on the specified Graphics object using the properties saved in this class.
method.param: recordKey The record key to initialize the fill style for.
graphics The Graphics object to initialize.

interfaceRec.name: IPlotter
interfaceRec.description: A class implementing IPlotter defines the properties required to display shapes corresponding to record keys. The interface includes basic functions for drawing and getting bounding boxes. This interface is meant to be as lightweight and generic as possible.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: drawBackground
method.description: This function draws the background graphics for this plotter, if there are any. An example background would be the origin lines of an axis.
method.param: dataBounds The data coordinates that correspond to the given screenBounds.
screenBounds The coordinates on the given sprite that correspond to the given dataBounds.
destination The sprite to draw the graphics onto.

method.name: drawPlot
method.description: Draws the graphics for a list of records onto a sprite.
method.param: recordKeys The list of keys that identify which records should be used to generate the graphics.
dataBounds The data coordinates that correspond to the given screenBounds.
screenBounds The coordinates on the given sprite that correspond to the given dataBounds.
destination The sprite to draw the graphics onto.

method.name: getBackgroundDataBounds
method.description: This function returns a Bounds2D object set to the data bounds associated with the background.
method.return: The data bounds associated with the background of the plotter.

method.name: getDataBoundsFromRecordKey
method.description: This function provides a mapping from a record key to an Array of bounds objects, specified in data coordinates, that cover the bounds associated with that record key. The simplest geometric object supported is Bounds2D. Other objects may be supported in future versions.
method.param: recordKey The key of a data record.
method.return: An Array of geometric objects, in data coordinates, that cover the bounds associated with the record key.

method.name: keySet
method.description: This is the set of record keys relevant to this IPlotter. An optional filter can be applied to filter the records before the plotter generates graphics for them.
method.return: The set of record keys that can be passed to the drawPlot() and getDataBoundsFromRecordKey() functions.

method.name: spatialCallbacks
method.description: This is an interface for adding callbacks that get called when any spatial properties of the plotter change. Spatial properties are those that affect the data bounds of visual elements. Whenever these callbacks get called, data bounds values previously returned from getDataBoundsFromRecordKey() become invalid.

interfaceRec.name: IPlotLayer
interfaceRec.description:
A PlotLayer is a UIComponent that draws the graphics of an IPlotter.
NOTE: This is a temporary interface just to get everything working. This interface should be redesigned to avoid dependencies on implementations such as SpatialIndex.
interfaceRec.author: adufilie

method.name: invalidateGraphics
method.description: This will be used to filter the graphics that are drawn, but not the records that were used to calculate the graphics.

method.name: plotter
method.description: This is the IPlotter that is used to draw graphics on the IPlotLayer.

method.name: subsetFilter
method.description: This key set allows you to filter the records before they are used to calculate the graphics.

interfaceRec.name: IPlotterWithGeometries
interfaceRec.description: This interface defines a plotter whose records are geometric objects with special probing and selection. A plotter which implements this interface is subject to polygon containment algorithms during probing and selection.
interfaceRec.author: kmonico

method.name: getGeometriesFromRecordKey
method.description: This function provides a mapping from a record key to an Array of IGeometry objects in data coordinates.
method.param: recordKey An IQualifiedKey for which to get its geometries.
minImportance The minimum importance of the geometry objects.
bounds The visible bounds.
method.return: An Array of IGeometry objects, in data coordinates.

classRec.name: WeakReference
classRec.description: WeakReference This class is a wrapper for a weak reference to an object. See the documentation for the Dictionary class for more info.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: value
method.description: value A weak reference to an object.

field.name: dictionary
field.description: dictionary The reference is stored as a key in this Dictionary, which uses the weakKeys option.

classRec.name: KDNode
classRec.description: This class defines a single node for a KDTree. It corresponds to a splitting plane in a single dimension and maps a k-dimensional key to an object. This class should not be used outside the KDTree class definition.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: KDNode
method.param: dimension the index of the dimension that the split plane should be defined on
key the k-dimensional key used to locate this node
object the object associated with the key

method.name: clearChildrenAndSetSplitDimension
method.description: This function does what the name says. It can be used for tree balancing algorithms.
method.param: value the new split dimension

method.name: getUnusedNode
method.description: This function uses object pooling to get an instance of KDNode.
method.return: Either a previously saved unused node, or a new node.

method.name: saveUnusedNode
method.description: This function is used to save old nodes for later use.
method.param: node The node to save for later.

field.name: key
field.description: The numbers in K-Dimensions used to locate the object

field.name: left
field.description: Child node corresponding to the left side of the splitting plane

field.name: location
field.description: The location of the splitting plane, derived from splitDimension This property is made public for speed concerns, though it should not be modified.

field.name: object
field.description: The object that is associated with the key

field.name: right
field.description: Child node corresponding to the right side of the splitting plane

field.name: splitDimension
field.description: The dimension that the splitting plane is defined on This property is made public for speed concerns, though it should not be modified.

field.name: unusedNodes
field.description: This array contains nodes no longer in use.

classRec.name: BLGNode
classRec.description:
BLGNode Binary Line Generalization Tree Node This class defines a structure to represent a streamed polygon vertex.
Reference: van Oosterom, P. 1990. Reactive data structures for geographic information systems. PhD thesis, Department of Computer Science, Leiden University, The Netherlands.
classRec.author: adufilie

field.name: index
field.description: These properties are made public for speed concerns, though they should not be modified.

classRec.name: KDTree
classRec.description: This class defines a K-Dimensional Tree.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: KDTree
method.description:
Constructs an empty KDTree with the given dimensionality.
TODO: add parameter for a vector of key,object pairs and create a balanced tree from those.

method.name: balance
method.description:
Balance the tree so there are an (approximately) equal number of points on either side of any given node. A balanced tree yields faster query times compared to an unbalanced tree.
NOTE: Balancing a large tree is very slow, so this should not be called very often.

method.name: clear
method.description: Remove all nodes from the tree.

method.name: compareNodes
method.description: This function is used to sort the results of queryRange().

method.name: insert
method.description: This function inserts a new key,object pair into the KDTree. Warning: This function could cause the tree to become unbalanced and degrade performance.
method.param: key The k-dimensional key that corresponds to the object.
object The object to insert in the tree.
method.return: A KDNode object that can be used as a parameter to the remove() function.

method.name: queryRange
method.param: minKey The minimum key values allowed for results of this query
maxKey The maximum key values allowed for results of this query
boundaryInclusive Specify whether to include the boundary for the query
sortDimension Specify an integer >= 0 for the dimension to sort by
sortDirection Specify either ASCENDING or DESCENDING
method.return: An array of pointers to objects with K-Dimensional keys that fall between minKey and maxKey.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove a single node from the tree.
method.param: node The node to remove from the tree.

method.name: nodeCount
method.description: The number of nodes in the tree.

field.name: ASCENDING
field.description: Use these values for the sortDirection parameter of queryRange().

field.name: allNodes
field.description: This vector contains pointers to all nodes in the tree.

field.name: autoBalance
field.description:
If this is true, the tree will automatically balance itself when queried after nodes are inserted.
NOTE: Balancing a large tree is very slow, so this will not give any benefit if the tree changes often.

field.name: dimensionality
field.description: The dimensionality of the KDTree.

field.name: needsBalancing
field.description: This flag will be true if the tree needs to be balanced before querying.

field.name: nodeStack
field.description: used internally to keep track of the current traversal operation

field.name: rootNode
field.description: This is the root of the tree.

classRec.name: VertexChainLink
classRec.description: VertexChainLink
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: areaOfTriangle
method.description: areaOfTriangle
method.param: a First point in a triangle.
b Second point in a triangle.
c Third point in a triangle.
method.return: The area of the triangle ABC.

method.name: equals2D
method.description: equals2D Returns true if x and y are equal between two VertexChainLink objects.

method.name: insert
method.description: insert Adds a new vertex to the end of the chain.

method.name: promoteAndInvalidateImportance
method.description: promoteAndInvalidateImportance
method.param: minImportance If the importance value of this vertex is less than minImportance, it will be set to minImportance.

method.name: removeFromChain
method.description: removeFromChain Updates prev and next pointers on adjacent VertexChainLinks so this link is removed.

method.name: validateImportance
method.description: updateImportance This function re-calculates the importance of the current point. It may only increase the importance, not decrease it.

classRec.name: ImageFactory
classRec.description: ImageFactory Use this class when you need an image Class but all you have is a BitmapData object.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: getImageClass
method.description: getImageClass
method.param: bitmapData Parameter for BitmapAsset constructor.
pixelSnapping Parameter for BitmapAsset constructor.
smoothing Parameter for BitmapAsset constructor.
cloneBitmapData Set this to true if you want the ImageFactory class constructor to clone the bitmapData.
method.return: The ImageFactory class, with its static parameters set.

classRec.name: BLGTree
classRec.description:
BLGTree Binary Line Generalization Tree This class defines a structure to represent a streamed polygon.
Reference: van Oosterom, P. 1990. Reactive data structures for geographic information systems. PhD thesis, Department of Computer Science, Leiden University, The Netherlands.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: BLGTree
method.description: BLGTree Create an empty tree.

method.name: clear
method.description: clear Removes all points from the BLGTree.

method.name: getPointVector
method.description: getPointVector This function performs an in-order traversal of nodes, skipping those with importance < minImportance. The visit operation is to append the current node to the traversalVector.
method.param: minImportance No points with importance less than this value will be returned.
visibleBounds If not null, this bounds will be used to remove unnecessary offscreen points.
method.return: A list of BLGNodes, ordered by point index.

method.name: insert
method.description: insert Insert a new vertex into the BLGTree.

method.name: splitAtIndex
method.description: splitAtIndex
method.param: splitIndex An index to split the tree at.
method.return: A new BLGTree containing all the points whose index >= splitIndex.

field.name: _lowestSavedImportance
field.description: lowestSavedImportance The lowest importance value for any point that has been stored in the tree

field.name: operationStack
field.description: operationStack & nodeStack used internally in getPointVector() to keep track of the current traversal operation

field.name: previousTraversalMinImportance
field.description: previousTraversalMinImportance This is the minImportance value from the last traversal. It can be used to avoid redundant traversal computations.

field.name: previousTraversalVisibleBounds
field.description: previousTraversalVisibleBounds This is the visibleBounds value from the last traversal. It can be used to avoid redundant traversal computations.

field.name: rootNode
field.description: rootNode This is the root of the BLGTree.

field.name: traversalVector
field.description: traversalVector This vector is used in getPointVector(). It contains pointers to nodes that are currently being traversed. The first entry in the vector is the root node, and each other entry corresponds to a child node of the previous entry.

classRec.name: GeneralizedGeometry
classRec.description: GeneralizedGeometry A generalized geometry is one that lends itself to be displayed at different quality levels. The geometry coordinates may be inserted individually through the "coordinates" property, or they can all be processed at once through the setCoordinates() function. The bounds object is separate from the coordinates, so if coordinates are inserted individually, the bounds object should be updated accordingly if you want it to be accurate.
classRec.author: adufilie

method.name: GeneralizedGeometry
method.description: GeneralizedGeometry Create an empty geometry.
method.param: geomType The type of the geometry (GEOM_TYPE_LINE, GEOM_TYPE_POINT, or GEOM_TYPE_POLYGON).

method.name: addPartMarker
method.description: addPartMarker Adds a part marker at the given vertexID and a corresponding geometry part. This function does not do any error checking, so part markers should be added in ascending order.
method.param: vertexID The vertexID that serves as a marker for separating the next geometry part.

method.name: addPoint
method.description: addPoint Inserts a new point into the appropriate part of the geometry.

method.name: getSimplifiedGeometry
method.description: getSimplifiedGeometry
method.param: minImportance No points with importance less than this value will be returned.
visibleBounds If not null, this bounds will be used to remove unnecessary offscreen points.
method.return: A vector of results from BLGTree.getPointVector(minImportance, visibleBounds) from each part.

method.name: setCoordinates
method.description: setCoordinates This function assigns importance values to a list of coordinates and replaces the contents of the BLGTree.
method.param: xyCoordinates An array of Numbers, even index values being x coordinates and odd index values being y coordinates.

method.name: isEmpty
method.description: isEmpty
method.return: true if the geometry has no information on its individual coordinates.

method.name: lowestSavedImportance
method.description: lowestSavedImportance The lowest importance value for any point that has been added to the geometry.

field.name: GEOM_TYPE_POINT
field.description: geometry types

field.name: bounds
field.description: bounds This is a bounding box for the geometry. It is useful for spatial indexing when not all the points are available yet.

field.name: geomType
field.description: geomType This is the type of the geometry. Value should be one of the static geometry types listed in this class.

field.name: partMarkers
field.description: partMarkers Each of these integers corresponds to a vertexID that separates the current part from the next part. For example, partMarkers[0] is the vertexID that marks the end of part 0 and the start of part 1.

field.name: parts
field.description: parts These are the coordinates associated with the geometry. Each element in this vector is a separate part of the geometry. Each could be either a new polygon or a hole in a previous polygon.

classRec.description:
LooseAxisDescription
code adapted from the UVP given: info about our data numTicksReq, dataMin, dataMax we calculate: what our axis will look like tickMin, tickMax, tickDelta axisMin, axisMax, numTicks and numDigits
classRec.author: sanbalagan

classRec.name: Geometry
classRec.description: This class acts as a wrapper for a general polygon.
